Proof.  We use the result that a ring defined by the intersection of a finite number of valuations is a Prüfer ring.  A proof of this is given in [ 12 ].  Then since w^, . . . ,  w „ have finite character the existence of such sxi x ^ К follows by Proposition 30.  The necessity of the family being concordant follows from Lemma 23. 
8.  Examples
We construct two examples of rings of Krull type ; the first construction uses a method first employed by Krull for constructing valuations with pre - assigned groups. 
We say that a lattice ordered group G satisfies Conrad's F - condition [ 1 ],  if every positive element is the sum of at most a finite number of disjoint elements.  Such groups have an irreducible representation in a direct sum of totally ordered groups,  ф Г^.  Let
p^ be the projection p^ : G - ^ Г^ ; then we call a subset S ш G semi - well - ordered if p^ { S ) is well ordered for every t ê / and is zero for almost all t 6 /.  Any subset of a semi - well - ordered set is semi - well - ordered,  and the union of a finite number of semi - well - ordered sets is semi - well - ordered.
